item.title: Using a deep recurrent neural network with EEG signal to detect Parkinson‚Äôs disease
item.description: pooling-based deep recurrent neural network (PDRNN) DRNN architecture The RNN maps the input vector to the equivalent output set . In this‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Annals of Translational Medicine (2020)

pooling-based deep recurrent neural network (PDRNN)

DRNN architecture

The RNN maps the input vector (x)(x)(x) to the equivalent output set (y)(y)(y). In this graph, the learning procedure is carried out in each time-step in the range of t=1‚ÄÖ‚ÄÖto‚ÄÖ‚ÄÖœÑt=1\:\:to\:\:œÑt=1toœÑ. The sharing states related to the variables of each node in the lthl^{th}lth layer are updated as follows

  • x(t)x(t)x(t): input in time-step ttt
  • y(t),ytarget(t)y(t), y_{target}(t)y(t),ytarget‚Äã(t): predicted and real output
  • hl(t)h_l(t)hl‚Äã(t): sharing states of layer lll

  • al(t)a_l(t)al‚Äã(t): input of lthl^{th}lth layer that is composed of

    1. x(t)x(t)x(t) or hl‚àí1(t)h_{l-1}(t)hl‚àí1‚Äã(t)
    2. bbb (bias values)
    3. hl(t‚àí1)h_{l}(t-1)hl‚Äã(t‚àí1)

‚áí Because of the shared features of the recurrent neural network, it is able to learn the iterated uncertainties of the prior time-steps

vanilla RNN ÎåÄÏã† LSTMÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï®ÏúºÎ°úÏç® overcome this problem by generating paths through which the gradient is able to flow in long periods

  • stratified 10-fold cross validation
  • Single Sign On (SSO) optimizer
  • 1E-4 training rate
  • activation functions such as Relu in all layers
  • softmax in the last layer
  • dropout is adjusted to 0.5 in the dropout layer

Parkinson's and healthy cases

20 PD patients (10 males and 10 females)

  • age range between 45 and 65 years old

  • average period of PD of 5.75 ¬± 3.52 years

    • ranging from 2 to 10 years

      • Phase 1: two patients
      • Phase 2: eleven patients
      • Phase 3: seven patients
  • The obtained Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) results were within the range of the typical boundaries of 25 to 30 (26.9 ¬± 1.51)

20 healthy cases with equal age range (9 males and 11 females) without past a record of neurological (or mental) disorders were also examined

  • The MMSE results obtained from the healthy cases were in the range of 27.15 ¬± 1.63 years.

Preprocessing phase and EEG signals

5 minutes in the steady state with a 128-Hz sample rate

emotive EPOC neuroheadset with 14 channels

the recorded signals were divided into 2-second window lengths

threshold method for eliminating the signals at a level higher than ¬±100 ŒºV (in order to eliminate the eye-blinking effects)

frequencies were filtered using a Butterworth six-order band-pass filter with the forward-reverse method

PDRNN analysis

  • Accuracy: 88.57%
  • Precision: 88.31%
  • Sensitivity: 84.84%
  • Specificity: 91.81%

performance of the model

  • with dropout layer
  • without dropout layer

‚Üí Remarkably, it was possible for over-fitting to occur in the model without a dropout layer.

Discussion

  • Í∏∞Ï°¥ Ïó∞Íµ¨ÏôÄÏùò ÎπÑÍµê
  • Ìñ•ÌõÑÎ™©Ìëú

  • The main novelties of the proposed method are summarized as follows

    1. A deep RNN architecture equipped with LSTM units can automatically detect PD using EEG signals
    2. The extraction, selection, and classification of the features is not required
    3. A stratified 10-fold cross validation method is used for authentication of the model
    4. This is the first time a deep learning method has been proposed to diagnose PD using EEG signals
    5. Good diagnostic efficiency could be achieved even with a low number of healthy and PD cases, which shows good robustness of the proposed model

  • Nevertheless, our proposed method and study may also exhibit the following limitations

    1. A low number of cases (20 healthy and 20 PD cases) were used for developing the proposed PDRNN model
    2. The proposed PDRNN model may have high computing costs in comparison with the traditional machine learning methods

Ï∞∏Í≥† ÏûêÎ£å

  • ÎÖºÎ¨∏: Using a deep recurrent neural network with EEG signal to detect Parkinson‚Äôs disease

item.title: A deep learning approach for Parkinson's disease diagnosis from EEG signals
item.description: Proposed CNN architecture stratified tenfold cross-validation Adam optimization with a learning rate of 0.0001 activation functions such as‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Neural Computing and Applications (2018)

Proposed CNN architecture

  • stratified tenfold cross-validation
  • Adam optimization with a learning rate of 0.0001
  • activation functions such as Relu for all layers
  • softmax for the last layer
  • dropout is set to 0.5

the kernel size and number of filters are obtained through the brute force technique

Subjects

20 PD patients (10 women and 10 men)

  • age range between 45 and 65 years old

  • average period of PD of 5.75 ¬± 3.52 years

    • ranging from 1 to 12 years

      • Stage (i) - 2
      • Stage (ii) - 11
      • Stage (iii) - 7
  • MNSE(mini-mental status examination) results: observed to be inside the range of the normal limits [26.90 ¬± 1.51 (range 25-30)]

20 normal subjects in the same age group (9 men and 11 women)

  • age of 58.10 ¬± 2.95
  • with no past record or indications of neurological or mental disorder were enlisted
  • MNSE results: 27.15 ¬± 1.63 years

EEG recordings and pre-processing

lasted 5 min in resting state (to attain a state of relaxed wakefulness) at 128 Hz sampling rate

emotive EPOC neuroheadset of 14 channels

the signals were segmented into 2-s window length

A threshold technique was used to discard the signal amplitudes exceeding ¬± 100 Œº\muŒºV to remove the eye blinking artifacts

6th-order bandpass Butterworth filter with forward reverse filtering technique was employed to filter the frequency range of 1-49 Hz

Results

  • Accuracy: 88.25%
  • Sensitivity: 84.71%
  • Specificity: 91.77%

performance of the model

  • with dropout layer
  • without dropout layer

‚Üí without the dropout layer, there is a possibility of overfitting of data

Discussion

  • Í∏∞Ï°¥ Ïó∞Íµ¨ÏôÄÏùò ÎπÑÍµê
  • Ìñ•ÌõÑÎ™©Ìëú

  • Ïû•Îã®Ï†ê

    • advantages

      1. A thirteen-layer CNN model is designed to automatically identify PD using EEG signals.
      2. Extraction, selection, and classification of features are not required in the proposed CNN model.
      3. The model is validated with a stratified tenfold crossvalidation technique.
      4. This is the first work to implement the deep learning technique for the detection of PD using EEG signals.
      5. It obtains good performance even with less number of normal and PD subjects. Hence, the developed is robust.

    • disadvantages

      1. It uses limited number of (20 normal and 20 PD) subjects to develop the CNN model.
      2. The CNN structure is computationally expensive as compared to the conventional machine learning techniques.

Ï∞∏Í≥† ÏûêÎ£å

  • ÎÖºÎ¨∏: A deep learning approach for Parkinson‚Äôs disease diagnosis from EEG signals

9. self-supervised learning

  • Self-supervised learningÏùÑ ÌïòÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌï¥ DecoderÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©

Transformer-DST

3. Overview

  • Decoder (Ïò§Î•∏Ï™Ω)ÏùÄ left-to-right attention (ÏôºÏ™ΩÏóêÏÑú Ïò§Î•∏Ï™ΩÏúºÎ°ú Ï∞®Î°ÄÎ°ú Ï∂úÎ†•ÌïòÎäî language model, Ï¶â ÏôºÏ™Ω Ï∂úÎ†•Í∞íÏù¥ Ïò§Î•∏Ï™Ω ÏûÖÎ†•)

4-1) Encoder Input

  • [SLOT]‚®Ådj‚®Å‚àí‚®Åsj‚®Å‚àí‚®Åvj[SLOT] \bigoplus d_{j} \bigoplus - \bigoplus s_{j} \bigoplus - \bigoplus v_{j}[SLOT]‚®Ådj‚Äã‚®Å‚àí‚®Åsj‚Äã‚®Å‚àí‚®Åvj‚Äã ÏúºÎ°ú Íµ¨ÏÑ±

    • ‚®Å\bigoplus‚®ÅÎäî concatÏùÑ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÉÑ

4-2) Multi-head self-attention

    • Mijx=0M^{x}_{ij} = 0Mijx‚Äã=0Ïù¥Î©¥ i-th positionÏù¥ j-th positionÏóê attendÌïòÎã§Îäî ÏùòÎØ∏
    • Mijx=‚àí‚àûM^{x}_{ij} = -\inftyMijx‚Äã=‚àí‚àûÏù¥Î©¥ i-th positionÍ≥º j-th positionÏùÑ preventsÌïòÍ≤†Îã§Îäî ÏùòÎØ∏

4-3) Encoder Output

XL=[xclsL,x1L,...,xsl1L,...,xslJL,...]X^{L} = [x^{L}_{cls}, x^{L}_{1}, ..., x^L_{sl_{1}}, ..., x^{L}_{sl_{J}},...]XL=[xclsL‚Äã,x1L‚Äã,...,xsl1‚ÄãL‚Äã,...,xslJ‚ÄãL‚Äã,...]

4-4) Encoder Objective

  • CARRYOVER, DELETE, DONTCARE, UPDATE
  • UPDATEÏùò Í≤ΩÏö∞ÏóêÎßå decoder generaterÏóêÏÑú ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï®

5. Decoder (Slot Value Generation)

  • Left-to-right self-attentionÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï®
  • EncoderÏóêÏÑú ÎèÑÏ∂úÌï¥ÎÇ∏ hidden statesÎ•º decoderÏóêÏÑú reuse
  • ResueÏùò ÏùòÎØ∏Îäî hidden stateÎ•º decoderÏóêÏÑú Îã§Ïãú ÌïúÎ≤à Í≥ÑÏÇ∞Ìï† ÌïÑÏöîÍ∞Ä ÏóÜÏñ¥ÏßÑÎã§Îäî ÏùòÎØ∏Î•º Í∞ñÏùå.

5-1) Decoder Input

  • Encoder (reuse)

    • ÏôºÏ™ΩÏùò DtD_{t}Dt‚ÄãÏôÄ [SLOT][SLOT][SLOT]ÏùÄ Encoder Î∂ÄÎ∂ÑÏùÑ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÉÑ
    • ÌòÑÏû¨ turnÏùò DtD_{t}Dt‚ÄãÏùò hidden state vectorÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï®

5-2) Left-to-right self-attention

5-3) Decoder Objective

Í≤∞Í≥º

  • EncoderÏóêÏÑú ÎÇòÏò® OperationÏùò Í≤∞Í≥ºÍ∞Ä Update Ïù∏ Í≤ΩÏö∞ Ìï¥Îãπ slotÏùò valueÎ•º ÏòàÏ∏°

  • SOM-DSTÏùò generatorÎäî valueÎ•º JJJÍ∞úÍ∞Ä ÏïÑÎãå Jt‚Ä≤J^\prime_tJt‚Ä≤‚ÄãÍ∞úÏùò slotÏóê ÎåÄÌï¥ÏÑúÎßå ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï§ÄÎã§.

    ÎåÄÎ∂ÄÎ∂ÑÏùò Í≤ΩÏö∞ÏóêÏÑú Jt‚Ä≤‚â™JJ^\prime_t \ll JJt‚Ä≤‚Äã‚â™JÏù¥Í∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê Îçî Ìö®Ïú®Ï†ÅÏù¥ÎùºÍ≥† Ï£ºÏû•

  • Decoder Î™®Îç∏Î°ú GRU ÏÇ¨Ïö©

    • ÏûÖÎ†•ÏúºÎ°ú word embedding vector etj,ke_t^{j,k}etj,k‚ÄãÎ•º Î∞õÏúºÎ©¥ÏÑú GRUÏùò hidden state vector gtj,kg_t^{j, k}gtj,k‚ÄãÎ•º recurrentÌïòÍ≤å ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏
    • gtj,0=htxg_t^{j, 0} = h_t^{\rm x}gtj,0‚Äã=htx‚Äã, etj,0=ht[slot]je_t^{j,0} = h_t^{[slot]j}etj,0‚Äã=ht[slot]j‚Äã: GRUÏóê Îì§Ïñ¥Í∞ÄÎäî Ï¥àÍ∏∞Í∞í
    • gtj,k=GRU(gtj,k‚àí1,etj,k)g_t^{j, k} = GRU(g_t^{j, k-1}, e_t^{j,k})gtj,k‚Äã=GRU(gtj,k‚àí1‚Äã,etj,k‚Äã)
    • etj,ke_t^{j,k}etj,k‚ÄãÍ∞Ä [EOS] ÌÜ†ÌÅ∞Ïù¥ ÎÇòÏò¨ÎïåÍπåÏßÄ ÏßÑÌñâ

    • hidden state gtj,kg_t^{j, k}gtj,k‚ÄãÎäî k-th decoding stepÏùÑ Í±∞ÏπòÎ©¥ÏÑú vocabulary ÏôÄ user utteranceÏùò Îã®Ïñ¥Ïóê ÎåÄÌïú ÌôïÎ•† Î∂ÑÌè¨Î°ú Î≥ÄÌï®

      Pvcb,tj,k=softmax(Egtj,k)‚ààRdvcbP^{j, k}_{vcb, t} = softmax(Eg^{j, k}_t) \in \mathbb R^{d_{vcb}}Pvcb,tj,k‚Äã=softmax(Egtj,k‚Äã)‚ààRdvcb‚Äã

      • E‚ààRdvcb√ódE \in \mathbb R^{d_{vcb}\times d}E‚ààRdvcb‚Äã√ód: EncoderÏôÄ DecoderÍ∞Ä ÏÑúÎ°ú Í≥µÏú†ÌïòÎäî word embedding matrix

        • dvcbd_{vcb}dvcb‚Äã: vocabulary size

      Pctx,tj,k=softmax(Htgtj,k)‚ààR‚à£Xt‚à£P^{j, k}_{ctx, t} = softmax(H_t g_t^{j, k}) \in \mathbb R^{\left|X_t\right|}Pctx,tj,k‚Äã=softmax(Ht‚Äãgtj,k‚Äã)‚ààR‚à£Xt‚Äã‚à£

      • user utteranceÏùò Îã®Ïñ¥Ïóê ÎåÄÌïú ÌôïÎ•† Î∂ÑÌè¨

      Pval,tj,k=Œ±Pvcb,tj,k+(1‚àíŒ±)Pctx,tj,kP^{j, k}_{val, t} = \alpha P^{j, k}_{vcb, t} + (1-\alpha) P^{j, k}_{ctx, t}Pval,tj,k‚Äã=Œ±Pvcb,tj,k‚Äã+(1‚àíŒ±)Pctx,tj,k‚Äã: final output distribution

      • Œ±=sigmoid(W1[gtj,k;etj,k;ctj,k])\alpha = sigmoid(W_1 \left[g^{j, k}_t ; e^{j, k}_t ; c^{j, k}_t\right])Œ±=sigmoid(W1‚Äã[gtj,k‚Äã;etj,k‚Äã;ctj,k‚Äã])

        • W1‚ààR1√ó(3d)W_1 \in \mathbb R^{1\times (3d)}W1‚Äã‚ààR1√ó(3d): learnable parameter
        • ctj,k=Pctx,tj,kHt‚ààRdc^{j, k}_t = P^{j, k}_{ctx, t} H_t \in \mathbb R^dctj,k‚Äã=Pctx,tj,k‚ÄãHt‚Äã‚ààRd: context vector

Objective Function

State operation predictor

Main Task

state operation classification

Auxiliary Task

domain classification

state operation classification Ïô∏ÏóêÎèÑ domain classificationÏùÑ Î≥¥Ï°∞ taskÎ°ú ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÏó¨ Î™®Îç∏Ïù¥ dialogue turn Í∞ÑÏùò slot operationÍ≥º domain transitionÏùò ÏÉÅÍ¥Ä Í¥ÄÍ≥ÑÎ•º ÌïôÏäµÌïòÎèÑÎ°ù Ìï®

Pdom,t=softmax(WdomhtX)P_{dom, t} = softmax(W_{dom} h_t^{\rm X})Pdom,t‚Äã=softmax(Wdom‚ÄãhtX‚Äã)

  • Wdom‚ààRddom√ódW_{dom} \in \mathbb R^{d_{dom}\times d}Wdom‚Äã‚ààRddom‚Äã√ód: learnable parameter

  • Pdom,t‚ààRddomP_{dom, t} \in \mathbb R^{d_{dom}}Pdom,t‚Äã‚ààRddom‚Äã: turn tÏóêÏÑú domainÏóê ÎåÄÌïú ÌôïÎ•† Î∂ÑÌè¨

    • ddomd_{dom}ddom‚Äã: # of domains defined in the dataset

Average of the negative log-likelihood

Lopr,t=‚àí1J‚àëj=1J(Yopr,tj)‚ä§log(Popr,tj)L_{opr, t} = -\frac{1}{J}\sum_{j=1}^{J}(Y_{opr, t}^j)^\top log(P^j_{opr, t})Lopr,t‚Äã=‚àíJ1‚Äã‚àëj=1J‚Äã(Yopr,tj‚Äã)‚ä§log(Popr,tj‚Äã)

Ldom,t=‚àí(Ydom,t)‚ä§log(Pdom,t)L_{dom, t} = -(Y_{dom, t})^\top log(P_{dom, t})Ldom,t‚Äã=‚àí(Ydom,t‚Äã)‚ä§log(Pdom,t‚Äã)

  • Ydom,t‚ààRddomY_{dom, t} \in \mathbb R^{d_{dom}}Ydom,t‚Äã‚ààRddom‚Äã: one-hot vector for the ground truth domain
  • Yopr,tj‚ààR‚à£O‚à£Y^j_{opr, t} \in \mathbb R^{\left| O\right|}Yopr,tj‚Äã‚ààR‚à£O‚à£: one-hot vector for the ground truth operation for the j-th slot

Slot value generator

Average of the negative log-likelihood

Lsvg,t=‚àí1‚à£Ut‚à£‚àëj‚ààUt[1Ktj‚àëk=1Ktj(Yval,tj,k)‚ä§log(Pval,tj,k)]L_{svg, t} = -\frac{1}{\left|\mathbb U_t\right|}\sum_{j\in\mathbb U_t}^{}\left[\frac{1}{K^j_t}\sum_{k=1}^{K^j_t}(Y_{val, t}^{j, k})^{\top}log(P^{j, k}_{val, t})\right]Lsvg,t‚Äã=‚àí‚à£Ut‚Äã‚à£1‚Äã‚àëj‚ààUt‚Äã‚Äã[Ktj‚Äã1‚Äã‚àëk=1Ktj‚Äã‚Äã(Yval,tj,k‚Äã)‚ä§log(Pval,tj,k‚Äã)]

  • KtjK_t^jKtj‚Äã: # of tokens of the ground truth value that needs to be generated for the j-th slot
  • Yval,tj,k‚ààRdvcbY_{val, t}^{j, k} \in \mathbb R^{d_{vcb}}Yval,tj,k‚Äã‚ààRdvcb‚Äã: one-hot vector for the ground truth token that needs to be generated for the j-th slot at the k-th decoding step

Final Loss

to minimized Ljoint,t=Lopr,t+Ldom,t+Lsvg,tL_{joint, t} = L_{opr, t} + L_{dom, t} + L_{svg, t}Ljoint,t‚Äã=Lopr,t‚Äã+Ldom,t‚Äã+Lsvg,t‚Äã

Experimental Setup

Datasets

MultiWOZ 2.0 and MultiWOZ 2.1

Training

  • Encoder : Bert-base-uncased
  • Decoder : GRU
  • Hidden size : 768
  • Optimizer : BertAdam
  • Encoder LR and warmup : 4e-5, 0.1
  • Decoder LR and warmup : 1e-4, 0.1

Í≤∞Í≥º

‚Ä† indicates the case where BERT-large is used for our model

Domain-specific Accuracy

ÌèâÍ∞Ä

item.title: A Contextual Hierarchical Attention Network with Adaptive Objective for Dialogue State Tracking
item.description: CHAN-DST slot imbalance Î¨∏Ï†úÎ•º Ìï¥Í≤∞ÌïòÍ≥†Ïûê adaptive objectiveÎ•º ÎèÑÏûÖ a contextual hierarchical attention network (CHAN)Î•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©: dislogue historyÏóêÏÑú relevant‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
CHAN-DST

  • slot imbalance Î¨∏Ï†úÎ•º Ìï¥Í≤∞ÌïòÍ≥†Ïûê adaptive objectiveÎ•º ÎèÑÏûÖ
  • a contextual hierarchical attention network (CHAN)Î•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©: dislogue historyÏóêÏÑú relevant contextÎ•º Ï∞æÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌï®
    ‚Üí Í∞Å ÌÑ¥Ïùò Î∞úÌôîÎ°úÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ word-level Í¥ÄÎ†® Ï†ïÎ≥¥ Í≤ÄÏÉâ
    ‚Üí contextual representationÏúºÎ°ú encode
    ‚Üí Î™®Îì† contextÌëúÌòÑÏùÑ turn-levelÍ¥ÄÎ†® Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î°ú ÏßëÍ≥ÑÌïú ÌõÑ word-level Ï†ïÎ≥¥ÏôÄ Ìï©Ïπú output ÏÉùÏÑ±
  • state transition prediction task

Definition

  • TTT: turn
  • UtU_tUt‚Äã: user utterance of turn t
  • RtR_tRt‚Äã: system response of turn t
  • XXX: {(U1,R1),...,(UT,RT)}\left\{(U_1, R_1), ... , (U_T, R_T)\right\}{(U1‚Äã,R1‚Äã),...,(UT‚Äã,RT‚Äã)}
  • BtB_tBt‚Äã: {(s,vt),s‚ààS}\left\{(s, v_t), s \in S\right\}{(s,vt‚Äã),s‚ààS}
  • SSS: set of slots
  • vtv_tvt‚Äã: corresponding value of the slot sss
  • slot: concatenation of a domain name and a slot name

Contextual Hierarchical Attention Network

1. Sentence Encoder

utterance encoder

  • BERT special token ÏÇ¨Ïö©
    ‚Üí [CLS] : Î¨∏Ïû•Ïùò representationÎì§ÏùÑ Ìï©ÏπòÍ∏∞ÏúÑÌï¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö© (to aggregate the whole representation of a sentence)
    ‚Üí [SEP] : Î¨∏Ïû•Ïùò ÎÅùÏùÑ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇ¥Í∏∞ÏúÑÌï¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©.
  • Ut={w1u,...,wlu}U_t = \left\{w_1^u, ..., w_l^u\right\}Ut‚Äã={w1u‚Äã,...,wlu‚Äã} (user utterance)
    Rt={w1r,...,wl‚Ä≤r}R_t = \left\{w_1^r, ..., w_{l'}^r\right\}Rt‚Äã={w1r‚Äã,...,wl‚Ä≤r‚Äã} (system response)
    ttt: dialogue turn
  • ht=BERTfinetune([Rt;Ut])h_t = BERT_{finetune}([R_t;U_t])ht‚Äã=BERTfinetune‚Äã([Rt‚Äã;Ut‚Äã])
    (hth_tht‚Äã: contextual word representations)
  • Ïó¨Í∏∞ÏÑú BERT finetuneÏùÄ trainingÎèÑÏ§ë finetuningÏù¥ Îê†Í≤ÉÏùÑ ÏùòÎØ∏.

slot-value encoder

  • BERTfixedBERT_{fixed}BERTfixed‚ÄãÎäî contextual semantics vectorsÎ°ú encodeÌï¥Ï§ÄÎã§.
  • utterance encodeÌï†ÎïåÏôÄ Îã§Î•∏ Ï†êÏùÄ [CLS] ÌÜ†ÌÅ∞Ïùò output vectorÎ•º Ï†ÑÏ≤¥ Î¨∏Ïû• representationÌï†Îïå ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïúÎã§. (to obtain the whole sentence representation)
  • hs=BERTfixed(s)h_s = BERT_{fixed}(s)hs‚Äã=BERTfixed‚Äã(s)
    htv=BERTfixed(vt)h_t^v = BERT_{fixed}(v_t)htv‚Äã=BERTfixed‚Äã(vt‚Äã)
  • BERTfixedBERT_{fixed}BERTfixed‚ÄãÎäî training ÎèÑÏ§ë Í≥†Ï†ïÎêòÏñ¥ÏûàÎã§. Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Ïö∞Î¶¨ Î™®Îç∏ÏùÄ unseen slots and valuesÏóê ÎåÄÌï¥ÏÑú original BERT representationÎ°ú ÌôïÏû•Ìï¥ÏÑú Î≥¥ÎäîÍ≤å Í∞ÄÎä•ÌïòÎã§.

2. Slot-Word Attention

  • slot-word attentionÏùÄ multi-head attentionÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïúÎã§.
  • cs,tword=MultiHead(hs,ht,ht)c_{s,t}^{word} = MultiHead(h^s, h_t, h_t)cs,tword‚Äã=MultiHead(hs,ht‚Äã,ht‚Äã)

3. Context Encoder

  • context encoder : unidirectional transformer encoder
  • {1, ..., t} ÌÑ¥ÏóêÏÑú Ï∂îÏ∂ú Îêú word-level slot-related Ï†ïÎ≥¥Ïùò contextual relevanceÎ•º Î™®Îç∏ÎßÅÌïòÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌïú Í≤É.

  • NNNÍ∞úÏùò idencticalÌïú layerÍ∞Ä ÏûàÎã§.

    • Í∞Å layerÎäî 2Í∞úÏùò sub-layerÎ•º Í∞ÄÏßÄÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§.
    • Ï≤´Î≤àÏß∏ sub-layer: masked multi-head self-attention(Q = K = V)
    • ÎëêÎ≤àÏß∏ sub-layer: position-wise fully connected feed-forward network(FFN) (two linear transformations, RELU activationÏúºÎ°ú Íµ¨ÏÑ±)
    • FFN(x)=max(0,xW1+b1)W2+b2FFN(x) = max(0, xW_1 + b_1)W_2 + b_2FFN(x)=max(0,xW1‚Äã+b1‚Äã)W2‚Äã+b2‚Äã
  • mn=FFN(MultiHead(mn‚àí1,mn‚àí1,mn‚àí1))m^n = FFN(MultiHead(m^{n-1}, m^{n-1}, m^{n-1}))mn=FFN(MultiHead(mn‚àí1,mn‚àí1,mn‚àí1))
    m0=[cs,1word+PE(1),...,cs,tword+PE(t)]m^0 = [c_{s,1}^{word} + PE(1), ..., c_{s,t}^{word} + PE(t)]m0=[cs,1word‚Äã+PE(1),...,cs,tword‚Äã+PE(t)]
    cs,‚â§tctx=mNc_{s,\leq t}^{ctx} = m^Ncs,‚â§tctx‚Äã=mN
  • mnm^nmn: nÎ≤àÏß∏ context encoderÎ†àÏù¥Ïñ¥Ïùò ÏïÑÏõÉÌíã PE(.)PE(.)PE(.): positional encoding function

4. Slot-Turn Attention

  • turn-level relevant informationÏùÑ contextual representationÏóêÏÑú Í≤ÄÏ∂úÌï¥ÎÇ¥Í∏∞ ÏúÑÌï¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©
  • cs,tturn=MultiHead(hs,cs,‚â§tctx,cs,‚â§tctx)c_{s,t}^{turn} = MultiHead(h^s, c_{s,\leq t}^{ctx},c_{s,\leq t}^{ctx})cs,tturn‚Äã=MultiHead(hs,cs,‚â§tctx‚Äã,cs,‚â§tctx‚Äã)
  • Ïù¥Î°úÏù∏Ìï¥ word-level and turn-level Ïùò relevant informationÏùÑ historical dialoguesÏóêÏÑú ÏñªÏñ¥ÎÇº Ïàò ÏûàÎã§.

5. Global-Local Fusion Gate

  • global contextÏôÄ local utteranceÏùò Í∑†ÌòïÏùÑ ÎßûÏ∂îÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌï¥, contextual informationÍ≥º current turn informationÏùò ÎπÑÏú®ÏùÑ Ï°∞Ï†àÌï®.
  • cs,tword,¬†¬†cs,tturnc_{s,t}^{word},~~ c_{s,t}^{turn}cs,tword‚Äã,¬†¬†cs,tturn‚ÄãÏóê Îî∞Îùº globalÍ≥º localÏ†ïÎ≥¥Í∞Ä Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å Í≤∞Ìï©ÎêòÏñ¥ÏïºÌï†ÏßÄ ÏïåÎ†§Ï£ºÎäî fusion gate mechanismÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©
  • gs,t=œÉ(Wg‚®Ä[cs,tword;cs,tturn])g_{s,t} = \sigma(W_g\bigodot[c_{s,t}^{word};c_{s,t}^{turn}])gs,t‚Äã=œÉ(Wg‚Äã‚®Ä[cs,tword‚Äã;cs,tturn‚Äã])

  • cs,tgate=gs,t‚®Çcs,tword+(1‚àígs,t‚®Çcs,tturn)c_{s,t}^gate = g_{s,t}\bigotimes c_{s,t}^{word} + (1-g_{s,t}\bigotimes c_{s,t}^{turn})cs,tg‚Äãate=gs,t‚Äã‚®Çcs,tword‚Äã+(1‚àígs,t‚Äã‚®Çcs,tturn‚Äã)

    • Wg‚ààR2d√ódW_g \in R^{2d\times d}Wg‚Äã‚ààR2d√ód
    • œÉ\sigmaœÉ: Sigmoid
    • ‚®Ä\bigodot‚®Ä, ‚®Ç\bigotimes‚®Ç
  • os,to_{s,t}os,t‚Äã = LayerNorm(Linear(Dropout(cs,tgatec_{s,t}^{gate}cs,tgate‚Äã)))

  • value vtv_tvt‚ÄãÏóê ÎåÄÌïú ÌôïÎ•†Î∂ÑÌè¨ÏôÄ training objective
    p(vt‚à£U‚â§t,¬†R‚â§t,s)=exp(‚àí‚à£‚à£os,t‚àíhtv‚à£‚à£2)‚àëv‚Ä≤‚ààVsexp(‚àí‚à£‚à£os,t‚àíhtv‚Ä≤‚à£‚à£2)p(v_t|U_{\leq t},~R_{\leq t}, s) = exp(-||o_{s,t} - h_t^v||2)\over {\sum{v'\in V_s}exp(-||o_{s,t}-h_t^{v'}||2)}‚àëv‚Ä≤‚ààVs‚Äãexp(‚àí‚à£‚à£os,t‚Äã‚àíhtv‚Ä≤‚Äã‚à£‚à£2)p(vt‚Äã‚à£U‚â§t‚Äã,¬†R‚â§t‚Äã,s)=exp(‚àí‚à£‚à£os,t‚Äã‚àíhtv‚Äã‚à£‚à£2)‚Äã
    LdstL{dst}Ldst =‚àës‚ààS‚àët=1T‚àílog(p(v^t‚à£U‚â§t,¬†R‚â§t,s))= \sum_{s\in S}\sum ^T_{t = 1}-log(p(\hat v_t|U_{\leq t},~R_{\leq t}, s))=‚àës‚ààS‚Äã‚àët=1T‚Äã‚àílog(p(v^t‚Äã‚à£U‚â§t‚Äã,¬†R‚â§t‚Äã,s))

    • VsV_sVs‚Äã: candidate value set of slot s
    • v^t‚ààVs\hat v_t \in V_sv^t‚Äã‚ààVs‚Äã: ground-truth value of slot s

State Transition Prediction

  • relevant contextÎ•º Îçî Ïûò Ìè¨Ï∞©ÌïòÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌï¥, auxiliary binary classification taskÏÇ¨Ïö©.
  • cs,tstp=tanh(Wc‚äôcs,tgate)c_{s,t}^{stp} = tanh(W_c \odot c_{s,t}^{gate})cs,tstp‚Äã=tanh(Wc‚Äã‚äôcs,tgate‚Äã)

  • ps,tstp=œÉ(Wp‚äô[cs,tstp;cs,t‚àí1stp])p_{s,t}^{stp} = \sigma (W_p \odot [c_{s,t}^{stp};c_{s, t-1}^{stp}])ps,tstp‚Äã=œÉ(Wp‚Äã‚äô[cs,tstp‚Äã;cs,t‚àí1stp‚Äã])

    • Wc‚ààRd√ódW_c \in \R^{d\times d}Wc‚Äã‚ààRd√ód
    • Wc‚ààR2dW_c \in \R^{2d}Wc‚Äã‚ààR2d
    • t=1t = 1t=1ÏùºÎïåÎäî cs,tstpc_{s,t}^{stp}cs,tstp‚ÄãÏôÄ zero vectorsÎ•º concatÌï®.
  • binary CE loss (ys,tstpy_{s,t}^{stp}ys,tstp‚Äã: ground-truth transition labels // ps,tstpp_{s,t}^{stp}ps,tstp‚Äã: transition probability)
  • Lstp=‚àës‚ààS‚àët=1T‚àíys,tstp¬†.¬†log(ps,tstp)L_{stp} = \sum_{s\in S}\sum_{t = 1}^T -y_{s,t}^{stp}~.~log(p_{s,t}^{stp})Lstp‚Äã=‚àës‚ààS‚Äã‚àët=1T‚Äã‚àíys,tstp‚Äã¬†.¬†log(ps,tstp‚Äã)

Adaptive Objective

  • hard slotsÏôÄ samplesÏóê Í¥ÄÌïú optimizationÏùÑ encourageÌïúÎã§.
  • all slotsÏùò learningÏùÑ balancingÌï®.
  • accsvalacc_s^{val}accsval‚Äã: accuracy of slot s on validation set

  • slot-level difficulty if accsval‚â§accs‚Ä≤valacc_s^{val} \leq acc_{s'}^{val}accsval‚Äã‚â§accs‚Ä≤val‚Äã;
    ‚Üí slot s Í∞Ä slot s'Î≥¥Îã§ Îçî Ïñ¥Î†§Ïö¥ Í≤É.
    ‚Üí Œ±\alphaŒ±: slot-level difficulty

    • Œ±s=1‚àíaccsval‚àës‚Ä≤‚ààS1‚àíaccs‚Ä≤val‚ãÖ‚à£S‚à£\alpha_s = {1 - acc_s^{val} \over {\sum_{s'\in S} 1-acc_{s'}^{val}}} \cdot |S|Œ±s‚Äã=‚àës‚Ä≤‚ààS‚Äã1‚àíaccs‚Ä≤val‚Äã1‚àíaccsval‚Äã‚Äã‚ãÖ‚à£S‚à£

  • sample-level difficulty
    ‚Üí Suppose there are two samples {(Ut,Rt),(s,vt)}\left\{(U_t, R_t),(s, v_t)\right\}{(Ut‚Äã,Rt‚Äã),(s,vt‚Äã)} and {(Ut‚Ä≤,Rt‚Ä≤),(s‚Ä≤,vt‚Ä≤)}\left\{(U_{t'}, R_{t'}),(s', v_{t'})\right\}{(Ut‚Ä≤‚Äã,Rt‚Ä≤‚Äã),(s‚Ä≤,vt‚Ä≤‚Äã)}
    ‚Üí ÎßåÏïΩ former confidence Í∞Ä latterÎ≥¥Îã§ Îçî ÎÇÆÎã§Î©¥, Ï≤´Î≤àÏß∏ sampleÏù¥ ÎëêÎ≤àÏß∏Î≥¥Îã§ Îçî Ïñ¥Î†§Ïö¥ Í≤É.
    ‚Üí Œ≤\betaŒ≤: sample level difficulty

    • Œ≤(s,vt)=(1‚àíp(s,vt))Œ≥\beta(s, v_t) = (1 - p(s, v_t))^\gammaŒ≤(s,vt‚Äã)=(1‚àíp(s,vt‚Äã))Œ≥
    • p(s,vt)p(s,v_t)p(s,vt‚Äã): confidence of sample (Ut,Rt),(s,vt)(U_t, R_t),(s, v_t)(Ut‚Äã,Rt‚Äã),(s,vt‚Äã)
      Œ≥\gammaŒ≥: hyper-parameter
  • Ladapt(s,vt)=‚àíŒ±sŒ≤(s,vt)log(p(s,vt))L_{adapt}(s,v_t) = -\alpha_s\beta(s, v_t)log(p(s, v_t))Ladapt‚Äã(s,vt‚Äã)=‚àíŒ±s‚ÄãŒ≤(s,vt‚Äã)log(p(s,vt‚Äã))
  • slot sÍ∞Ä ÌèâÍ∑† slotÏùò difficultyÎ≥¥Îã§ ÎÜíÎã§Î©¥, Œ±s\alpha_sŒ±s‚ÄãÎäî sÏóê ÎåÄÌïú lossÎ•º ÌÇ§Ïö∏ Í≤ÉÏù¥Îã§. ÎπÑÏä∑ÌïòÍ≤å, sampleÏùò optimizationÏù¥ low confidenceÎ•º Í∞ñÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§Î©¥ lossÎäî Ïª§ÏßàÍ≤ÉÏù¥Îã§.

Optimization

  • During joint training, we optimize the sum of these two loss functions as following
    Ljoint=Ldst+LstpL_{joint} = L_{dst} + L_{stp}Ljoint‚Äã=Ldst‚Äã+Lstp‚Äã
  • At the fine-tuning phase, we adopt the adaptive objective to fine-tune DST task as following
    Lfinetune=‚àës‚ààS‚àët=1TLadapt(s,v^t)L_{finetune} = \sum_{s\in S}\sum^T_{t=1}L_{adapt(s, \hat v_t)}Lfinetune‚Äã=‚àës‚ààS‚Äã‚àët=1T‚ÄãLadapt(s,v^t‚Äã)‚Äã

Ï∞∏Í≥† ÏûêÎ£å

2. Definition (Terminology)

4. State Generator

    Îã§ÏùåÏúºÎ°úÎäî Ïù¥ ÌÜ†ÌÅ∞ÏùÑ ÏûÖÎ†•ÏúºÎ°ú ÎÑ£Ïñ¥Ï£ºÍ≥†.. Í≥ÑÏÜçÌïòÏó¨ ÏïåÎßûÎäî value Î•º ÎΩëÏïÑÎÇ∏Îã§ (ÏÑúÏö∏ + Î°ØÎç∞ + Ìò∏ÌÖî).
    Í∑∏Îü¨Îã§ special token Ïù¥ ÎÇòÏò§Î©¥ value ÏÉùÏÑ±ÏùÑ Í∑∏ÎßåÌïúÎã§.

  • Pointer-Generator Î∞©Î≤ï ÏÇ¨Ïö©

    • ÏúÑÏóêÏÑú ÏÉùÏÑ±Îêú hj0dech^{dec}_{j0}hj0dec‚ÄãÎ°ú pvocabp_{vocab}pvocab‚Äã(ÎåÄÌôîÏôÄ Ïä¨Î°ØÏùÑ Î¥§ÏùÑ Îïå vocab ÏóêÏÑúÎäî Ïñ¥Îñ§ Îã®Ïñ¥ÏôÄ Ïú†ÏÇ¨ÌïúÏßÄ), phistp_{hist}phist‚Äã(ÎåÄÌôîÏôÄ Ïä¨Î°ØÏùÑ Î¥§ÏùÑ Îïå Ïù¥Ï†úÍπåÏßÄÏùò ÎåÄÌôî Ï§ëÏóêÏÑúÎäî Ïñ¥Îñ§ Îã®Ïñ¥ÏôÄ Ïú†ÏÇ¨ÌïúÏßÄ)Î•º Íµ¨ÌïúÎã§.

Slot GateÎäî Context vectorÎ°úÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ slotÏùò Ï°¥Ïû¨ Ïó¨Î∂ÄÎ•º ÏïåÏïÑÎÇ¥Îäî Ïó≠Ìï†ÏùÑ ÏàòÌñâ

Slot gate GjG_{j}Gj‚ÄãÎäî Îã§Ïùå ÏõêÏÜåÎ°ú Íµ¨ÏÑ±Îê®
